page.title: 18A Days Work - Bromp on Swale
page.content: ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY A BOY WORKS AT A VILLAGE PUB CALLED THE KING WILLIAM IV.HE STARTS AT 9.30am TILL 11.30am. HIS JOB IS TO REFILL THE SHELVES IN THE BARS FROM THE STOCK IN THE CELLAR. THESE ARE SOME OF THE TYPES OF DRINKS SOLD IN THE PUB,MAGNET OLD ALE,PALE ALE,BITTER,DOUBLE BROWN,GUINESS,PILS, SHANDY,LEMONADE,LIME,BLACKCURANT,SODA WATER AND OTHERS.AFTER GETTING THE STOCK FROM THE CELLAR HE GOES BACK INTO THE BAR AND WIPES THE BOTTLES SO THAT THE BAR MAIDS DONT GET MUCKY HANDS.NEXT HE TAKES THE EMPTY BOTTLES AND SORTS THEM INTO THEIR OWN CRATES, THESE ARE STORED IN THE CELLAR READY FOR THE BREWERY TO COLLECT.IN THE WINTER HE ALSO BRINGS LOGS FROM THE GARAGE AS WELL AS COAL FROM THE BUNKER FOR THE FIRES IN THE BARS.WHEN HE HAS FINISHED WORKING ON A SUNDAY,HE IS GIVEN HIS WAGES BY THE LANDLORD.
